required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Use of PRF in Treatment of Dry Socket.
clinical_study.official_title: Evaluation of Platelet Rich Fibrin Use in the Treatment of Dry Socket.

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of the study is to evaluate the influence of PRF application in case of alveolar osteitis.

detailed_description.textblock: The main objective was to compare the effects of using two different methods in the treatment of dry socket (alveolar osteitis), which is a postoperative complication of dental extraction. The first was Nipas, applied, if dry socket was diagnosed following a tooth extraction. In case of subsequent extraction of homonymous tooth and reoccurrence of dry socket, patients were treated with application of PRF.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: The first medicine was applied, if dry socket was diagnosed following a tooth extraction. In case of subsequent extraction of homonymous tooth in the same patient and reoccurrence of dry socket, patients were treated with PRF application.

primary_outcome.measure: Intensity of pain vs. PRF and Nipas application
primary_outcome.description: In order to evaluate the relationship between intensity of pain after application of PRF and Nipas, , NRS (Numeric Rating Scale) pain scale is used. NRS scale, ranges from 0 to 10; where 0 refers to no pain and 10 refers to most severe pain.

primary_outcome.measure: Influence of treatment on bacteria levels in wounds
primary_outcome.description: The second part of the study was dedicated to analyzing the number of bacteria in tooth extraction wounds.

arm_group.description: Patients with alveolar osteitis in which PRF application was performed.
Patients with alveolar osteitis in which Nipas was used.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- no known medical history of abnormal platelet counts,
- patients with symmetric teeth qualified for extraction,
Exclusion Criteria:
- patients treated previously for existing dry socket,
- patients allergic to acetylsalicylic acid ,
- systemic diseases,
- pregnancy,
- lactation,
- drugs known to affect the number or function of platelets,
- abnormal platelet counts,
